text.section: Application for voluntary admission of an individual to a facility may be made under this section by the individual, if the individual is 16 years old or older.

The applicant shall:
Submit a formal, written application that contains the personal information and is on the form required by the Administration; or
Informally request admission.

section.section: In addition to the limitations in subsection (c) of this section, a State facility may not admit an individual who is 65 years old or older unless a geriatric evaluation team determines that there is no available, less restrictive form of care or treatment that is adequate for the needs of the individual.

If admission is denied because of the determination of the geriatric evaluation team, the team shall:
Inform the individual; and
Help the individual obtain the less restrictive form of care or treatment that the geriatric evaluation team finds would be adequate for the needs of the individual.
